sn40.2:3.1: 2 A Question on the Second Absorption
sn40.2:4.1: “‘They speak of this thing called the “second absorption”.
sn40.2:4.4: ‘As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of samādhi, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
sn40.2:4.5: This is called the second absorption.’
sn40.2:4.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the second absorption.
sn40.2:4.7: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by placing the mind beset me.
sn40.2:5.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic powers and said:
sn40.2:5.3: Don’t neglect the second absorption, brahmin! Settle your mind in the second absorption; unify your mind and bring it to samādhi in the second absorption.’
sn40.2:5.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the second absorption.
sn40.2:5.5: So if anyone should be rightly called
sn40.2:5.6: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
